p: Overall, 77 (56.62%) patients underwent a chest CT scan, and 41 (53.25%) of them were diagnosed with viral pneumonia by chest CT scan. The distribution of patients who underwent a chest CT scan, and the image features are shown in Table 2 . The COVID-19 group (83.33%) had a higher rate of pneumonia in the chest CT scan than Flu A (48.39%, P = 0.018) and Flu B (14.29%, P < 0.001) viral infection groups, but had no difference with the RSV infection group (64.29%, P = 0.252). Patients with Flu B infection were more likely to have a normal chest CT scan compared with other virus infection groups (P < 0.05). Most of the pneumonia patients had multiple ground-glass opacity in the chest CT scan, there were no differences in opacity among the four groups (P > 0.05).
